caseTitle: Sana Jamali v. Mujeeb Qamar & another
tagline: Requirement of substituted service under Order V Rule 20 C.P.C and effectiveness. Against the judgment of Family Court, a right of appeal is provided under Section 14 of the Family Courts Act 1964. Ubi jus ubi remedium (wherever there is a right, there is a remedy). Writ jurisdiction could not be exercised to bypass the remedy of appeal which is also against the doctrine of exhaustion of remedies.
